cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.SOC. 

The paper deals with measuring fairness in ranked lists, which is a problem commonly studied in information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also discusses the impact of user attention on fairness, which is a topic that falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.CY). Additionally, the paper introduces a novel metric for measuring fairness, which could be considered a contribution to the field of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of non-binary protected attributes, which could be relevant to the field of social computing (cs.SOC). Finally, the paper discusses the application of the proposed metric to various services, which could be relevant to the field of web science (cs.SI).
